oai_dc:dc.dc:title: POE modified PDMS-POE-NaClO4 polymer electrolytes for solid state batteries
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: SHAYAMALA, S
PATNI, MJ
KULKARNI, AR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: polymer electrolyte
polyoxyethylene
polysiloxane
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Polymer electrolyte complexes comprising polyoxyethylene modified polydimethylsiloxane/polyoxyethylene/NaClO4 have been prepared. Solvent free ternary polymer blends synthesized by varying the mole percent of POE nd O/Na ratio have been characterized using infrared spectroscopy, X-ray diffraction, differential scanning calorimeter and impedance measurements. Room temperature conductivity of the order of 10(-3) Omega(-1) cm(-1) was achieved for POE/4% POE - PDMS/NaClO4 blends at O/Na ratio = 12. Conductivities at room temperature are comparable to those of liquid organic solvents used in batteries, suggesting that these electrolytes can be used as an alternative to liquid systems.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 5th International Symposium on Advances in Electrochemical Science and Technology,MADRAS, INDIA,NOV 24-26, 1994
